sentence.Network_en: He had coarsened his voice to an approximation of Cockney.
sentence.Network_cn: 他让自己的口音变得粗俗起来，接近伦敦东区的发音。

sentence.Network_en: That's just an approximation, you understand.
sentence.Network_cn: 你知道那仅仅是近似值。

sentence.Network_en: This is the nearest approximation of cost that they can give us.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是他们能够给我们的最接近的费用估价.

entry.def: An approximation is a fact, object, or description which is similar to something else, but which is not exactly the same.

example.ex: That is a fair approximation of the way in which the next boss is being chosen.
example.tran: 那和下一任老板的选任方式相当类似。

entry.def: An approximation is a number, calculation, or position that is close to a correct number, time, or position, but is not exact.

example.ex: Clearly that's an approximation, but my guess is there'll be a reasonable balance.
example.tran: 很明显那是个粗略的估计，但我猜会有一笔不少的余额。

means.word_mean: 1. an approximate calculation of quantity or degree or worth;

sentences.sentence: "an estimate of what it would cost"
"a rough idea how long it would take"

means.word_mean: 2. the quality of coming near to identity (especially close in quantity)

sentences.sentence: "newspapers gave only an approximation of the actual events"

means.word_mean: 4. the act of bringing near or bringing together especially the cut edges of tissue

auth_sentence.content: It's a closer approximation than what was done previously.

stems_affixes.word_buile: proxim接近,靠近+ity表名词→n.接近,附近
ap不断+proxim接近,靠近+ate表动词→v.[to]接近

Sentence.sentence: The problem is that the statistics aren't an objective measure of reality; they are simply a best approximation.

sentences.en: This is the nearest approximation of cost that they can give us.
sentences.cn: 这是他们能够给我们的最接近的费用估价。

sentences.en: This is only a crude approximation of the actual conditions in the area.
sentences.cn: 这只是对这一地区实际情况的粗略估计。

sentences.en: We do not have the true figures so we will have to make some approximations.
sentences.cn: 我们没有真实的数字，因此只能作些粗略的估计。
